analyzed: 'dir ni ci bzhin nus pas bya //

original: 'dir 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bstan bcos mtha' dag thugs su chud pas legs par sbyangs pa /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bstan bcos mtha' dag thugs su chud pas legs par sbyangs pa /
translated: Here, having understood all the mundane and supramundane treatises, one is well trained.

original: ku sha'i rtse mo lta bu'i blo mnga' ba'i slob dpon phyogs gnyis nges par spangs pas don dam pa ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pa'i yul du gyur pa /
analyzed: ku sha'i rtse mo lta bu'i blo mnga' ba'i slob dpon phyogs gnyis nges par spangs pas don dam pa ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pa'i yul du gyur pa /
translated: The master has a mind like the tip of a ku≈õa blade, having completely abandoned the two extremes, and has become an object of knowledge of the ultimate just as it is.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa srung bar mdzad pa'i thugs kyi rgyud mnga' ba /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa srung bar mdzad pa'i thugs kyi rgyud mnga' ba /

original: snying rje bla na med pas pha rol la phan par mdzad pa'i dgongs pa can /
analyzed: snying rje bla na med pas pha rol la phan par mdzad pa'i dgongs pa can /
translated: He has the intention to benefit others through unsurpassed compassion.

original: snyigs ma lngas 'phags pa'i nyon mongs pa du ma 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna la sogs pa'i nyes pas yid bcom pa'i 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba la gzigs nas /
analyzed: snyigs ma lngas 'phags pa'i nyon mongs pa du ma 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna la sogs pa'i nyes pas yid bcom pa'i 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba la gzigs nas /

original: gdul bya de dag gi don du rang dad pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du song bas /
analyzed: gdul bya de dag gi don du rang dad pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du song bas /
translated: for the sake of those disciples, having first paid homage to one's deity,

original: mdor bsdus pa'i rim pa lnga gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i rim pa lnga gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the five stages are taught in brief.

original: 'dir yang brjod par bya ba la sogs pa gsum med na /
analyzed: 'dir yang brjod par bya ba la sogs pa gsum med na /

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag rnams 'jug par mi 'gyur te /

original: sems can thams cad lam dam pa la dgod pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad lam dam pa la dgod pa ni dgos pa'o //

analyzed: phyag rgya chen po grub cing sems can gyi don la 'khor ba'i srid du gnas pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //

analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang po yin //

original: sems la dmigs pa tsam zhig ni //

analyzed: yid 'ong rim pa gsum pa'o //

analyzed: kun rdzob bden pa'i dag pa ni//

original: rim pa bzhi par brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rim pa bzhi par brjod pa yin //

original: zung 'jug ces bya rim pa lnga //

analyzed: ye shes kyi mtshan nyid can dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //

analyzed: de la ye shes kyi mtshan nyid can ni ye shes rnam pa lnga'i skus sangs rgyas thams cad de /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of all buddhas.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the body of perfect enjoyment is

analyzed: gang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan cing sems can thams cad lam la rab tu dgod par mdzad pa'i phyir ro // mgon po skyob par gyur pa ste //
translated: that it is adorned with the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of a great being and is the cause for establishing all sentient beings on the path.üîΩIt is the protector, the refuge,

original: skyabs su 'os zhes bya'i bar du'o //
analyzed: skyabs su 'os zhes bya'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the worthy object of refuge.

original: de ltar tshig rnam pa gnyis kyis @144a * //
analyzed: de ltar tshig rnam pa gnyis kyis @144a * //
translated: Thus, with two phrases,

original: go rims ci lta ba bzhin zab pa dang / rgya che ba'i bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la phyag byas nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: go rims ci lta ba bzhin zab pa dang / rgya che ba'i bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la phyag byas nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: having paid homage to the body of the transcendent lord, which has the nature of the profound and the vast, respectively, what will be done?

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
translated: The stage of vajra-recitation will be explained.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa ni 'og nas 'chad ba'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul te /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa ni 'og nas 'chad ba'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul te /
translated: Vajra-recitation is the method of the nature of the stage to be explained below.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa de bshad par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa de bshad par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the stage of vajra-recitation will be explained.

original: gang las she na rnal 'byor rgyud kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: gang las she na rnal 'byor rgyud kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: From what? From the Yoga Tantra, etc. Yoga is the concentration of mind.

original: de gtso bor gyur pa'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud do //
analyzed: de gtso bor gyur pa'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud do //
translated: The Tantra in which that is primary is the Yoga Tantra.

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas zhes bya ba ni bsten nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas zhes bya ba ni bsten nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Following that means relying on it.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Therefore, following the Yoga Tantra,

original: 'dir yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas nas /
analyzed: 'dir yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas nas /
translated: here, having paid homage to the Blessed One endowed with all perfect qualities,

original: de ma thag tu tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi rim pa la 'jug pa'i bslab pa dang / rin po che'i skud pa ltar khyab pa'i rim pa ji ltar bstan pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ma thag tu tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi rim pa la 'jug pa'i bslab pa dang / rin po che'i skud pa ltar khyab pa'i rim pa ji ltar bstan pa gsungs te /
translated: Immediately after that, he spoke the two verses, the stages of the training in entering, and the stages of the teaching of the pervasion like a precious thread.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The generation stage and so on.

original: gang 'di las dang po pa'i ste /
analyzed: gang 'di las dang po pa'i ste /
translated: For those who are beginners,

original: bskyed pa'i rim pas slob bzhin pa /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pas slob bzhin pa /
translated: who are training in the generation stage,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pas mngon par 'dod pa de rnams la bcom ldan 'das thugs rje'i pha rol tu phyin pas rim pa lnga pa'i mtshan nyid thabs de thob par byed pa'i rgyu skas kyi rim pa lta bu gsal bar byas te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pas mngon par 'dod pa de rnams la bcom ldan 'das thugs rje'i pha rol tu phyin pas rim pa lnga pa'i mtshan nyid thabs de thob par byed pa'i rgyu skas kyi rim pa lta bu gsal bar byas te /
translated: and who aspire to the completion stage, the BhagavƒÅn, who has perfected compassion, has clarified the five stages, which are the cause for attaining the method that has the characteristics of a staircase.

original: ji ltar khang bzangs la 'dzeg pa'i phyir skas kyi rim pa'i rgyur gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar khang bzangs la 'dzeg pa'i phyir skas kyi rim pa'i rgyur gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a staircase is the cause for ascending a mansion,

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i don du rim pa 'di mkhas pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i don du rim pa 'di mkhas pas shes par bya'o //
translated: in the same way, this stage should be understood by the wise for the purpose of attaining the desired state.

original: srog ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: srog ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Life force and so on.

original: srog tu gyur pa ni 'dzin cing 'tsho zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srog tu gyur pa ni 'dzin cing 'tsho zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Life means that which holds and sustains.

original: gang zhe na rlung zhes bya ba ste kun du g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na rlung zhes bya ba ste kun du g-yo ba'o //
translated: What is that? It is called wind, which means that which moves everywhere.

original: sems can ni lus dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can ni lus dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Sentient beings possess bodies.

original: rlung med na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rlung med na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Without wind, there would be no coming and going.

original: / de gnyis kyi bskyod pa dang kun du g-yo ba la sogs pa'i bya ba thams cad byed pas na las kun byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: / de gnyis kyi bskyod pa dang kun du g-yo ba la sogs pa'i bya ba thams cad byed pas na las kun byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since it performs all the functions of movement, shaking, and so on of those two, it is called the all-function.

original: rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa ni yid de de'i bzhon pa ni shing rta dang rta la skyes bu zhon pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa ni yid de de'i bzhon pa ni shing rta dang rta la skyes bu zhon pa lta bu'o //
translated: Consciousness and so on means consciousness, which is the mental faculty, and its mount, like a person mounted on a chariot or horse.

original: 'di skad gsungs @144b te ;üîΩ/ rlung zhes bya ba'i bzhon pa la //
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs @144b te ; / rlung zhes bya ba'i bzhon pa la //
translated: It is stated:üîΩThe consciousness, mounted on the wind

original: rnam par shes pa zhon nas las kun byed //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhon nas las kun byed //
translated: called the all-function, performs all actions.

original: ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'di ltar ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ston par 'gyur te /
translated: It is taught like this:üîΩThe wind, with the nature of emptiness,

original: rlung ni stong pa'i ngo bo dang // shes pa kun du 'dres gyur nas //
analyzed: rlung ni stong pa'i ngo bo dang // shes pa kun du 'dres gyur nas //
translated: mingles with consciousness,

original: dbang po'i lam nas 'byung 'gyur te //

analyzed: dang po lnga ni lus kyi bya ba la rnam par zhen pa'o //

analyzed: phyi mar gyur ba ni dbang po lnga brten nas yul 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: de la srog ces bya ba'i rlung ni snying gar gnas pa mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin te /

translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúlike an illusion‚Äù shows the illusion-like meditative concentration.

translated: When one enters into the conventional truth by means of the twelve examples of illusion, then, abiding in that, one realizes one‚Äôs mind as it is. Having realized the illusion-like meditative concentration, one attains the consecration of the Buddha.üîΩThe twelve examples that generate the illusion are the illusion, the mirage, the moon in water, the rainbow, the reflection in a mirror, the dream, the magical creation, the water bubble, the whirling firebrand, the sky flower, the rabbit‚Äôs horns, and

analyzed: de nas ril por 'dzin pa la rdul phra rab kyi bye brag gi ting nge 'dzin gyis yang dag pa'i mthar rab tu 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rab tu 'jug ste 'di skad du gnyis med ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: gang gi tshe zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin de kho nar gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gnas pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: gang la yang mi slob ste /

original: de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtogs par gyur na legs par sbyangs pa dang legs par ma sbyangs pa'i slob ma rjes su gzung ba'i phyir sngags dang / lha dang / bdag dang / phyag rgya'i de kho nas rim pa lnga gsal bar ston te ;
analyzed: de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtogs par gyur na legs par sbyangs pa dang legs par ma sbyangs pa'i slob ma rjes su gzung ba'i phyir sngags dang / lha dang / bdag dang / phyag rgya'i de kho nas rim pa lnga gsal bar ston te ;
translated: Thus, if one has realized the completion stage by means of the creation stage, then in order to take care of disciples who are well trained and not well trained, the five stages are clearly taught by means of the reality of mantra, deity, self, and seal.

original: de la ngag rnam par dpyod pa ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid de rlung gi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid ni rim pa gcig go //
analyzed: de la ngag rnam par dpyod pa ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid de rlung gi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid ni rim pa gcig go //
translated: Among them, the analysis of speech is the reality of mantra, which is the reality of wind and the reality of deity, which is one stage.

original: sems la dmigs pa ni bdag gi de kho na nyid gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa ni bdag gi de kho na nyid gnyis pa'o //
translated: The observation of mind is the reality of self, which is the second.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni phyag rgya'i de kho na nyid de gsum pa'o ;
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni phyag rgya'i de kho na nyid de gsum pa'o ;
translated: The stage of self-consecration is the reality of seal, which is the third.

original: / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba gnyis ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba gnyis ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The two, called manifest complete enlightenment and union, are the essence of the result.

original: de bas na lus rnam par dpyod pa med na /
analyzed: de bas na lus rnam par dpyod pa med na /
translated: Therefore, if one does not analyze the body,

original: ngag rnam par dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin med pa'o //
analyzed: ngag rnam par dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin med pa'o //
translated: There is no meditative stabilization that analyzes speech.

original: de med na sems rnam par dpyod pa khong du chud pa med do//
analyzed: de med na sems rnam par dpyod pa khong du chud pa med do//
translated: If that does not exist, there is no comprehension of the analysis of mind.

original: @146b de med na kun rdzob kyi bden pa la 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: @146b de med na kun rdzob kyi bden pa la 'jug pa med do //
translated: If that does not exist, there is no engagement with conventional truth.

original: de med na don dam pa'i bden pa sngon du bya ba med do //
analyzed: de med na don dam pa'i bden pa sngon du bya ba med do //
translated: If that does not exist, there is no prior engagement with ultimate truth.

original: de yang med na zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa mngon sum du rtogs par byed mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de yang med na zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa mngon sum du rtogs par byed mi nus pa'o //
translated: If that also does not exist, one is unable to realize the stage of union.

original: 'di ltar rim pa 'dis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rim pa 'dis bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in this stage.

original: rim pa lnga pa'i bshad ba mdor bstan pa'o /
analyzed: rim pa lnga pa'i bshad ba mdor bstan pa'o /
translated: This is the brief explanation of the five stages.

original: // / da ni tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis kyis zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phan yon ston te /
analyzed: // / da ni tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis kyis zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phan yon ston te /
translated: Now, two verses teach the benefits of the meditative stabilization of union.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for ‚Äúthis‚Äù and so forth,

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the meditative stabilization of union that was just explained,

original: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bshad do ;
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bshad do ;
translated: which is explained as the perfection stage.

original: / gong du 'gro ba'i mthar thug pas na /
analyzed: / gong du 'gro ba'i mthar thug pas na /
translated: Since it is the ultimate of all that goes higher,

original: de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: That is the Great Vajradhara.

original: de dag dbyer med pa'i phyir de nyid kyi na /
analyzed: de dag dbyer med pa'i phyir de nyid kyi na /
translated: Because of their inseparability,

original: zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa la 'jug pas slob bzhin pa'i so so'i skye bo la yang thams cad mkhyen pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa la 'jug pas slob bzhin pa'i so so'i skye bo la yang thams cad mkhyen pa 'byung ste /
translated: in that very [stage of] union, the omniscience of the ordinary person who is still in training arises,

original: sangs rgyas nyid rab tu 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid rab tu 'thob pa'o //
translated: and one attains Buddhahood.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be endowed with the highest of all aspects, and so forth.

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pas rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan no //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog dang ldan pas rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan no //
translated: Endowed with the highest of all aspects means endowed with the highest of all aspects.

original: shes bya'i phung po thams cad khyab par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: shes bya'i phung po thams cad khyab par mdzad pas na /
translated: Because it pervades the entire mass of objects of knowledge,

original: thams cad mkhyen pas de nas 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas de nas 'gyur //
translated: it is omniscience.

original: zhes bya'o // 'dis ni shin tu phra ba'i shes bya'i sgrib pa yang 'joms par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'dis ni shin tu phra ba'i shes bya'i sgrib pa yang 'joms par ston to //
translated: This shows that it also conquers the obscurations to omniscience, which are very subtle objects of knowledge.

original: da ni 'dis dus gsum yongs su shes pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni 'dis dus gsum yongs su shes pa ston te /
translated: Now, this shows the complete knowledge of the three times.

original: 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to what is called the past, and so forth,

original: gang cung zad 'jig rten gsum na gnas pa /
analyzed: gang cung zad 'jig rten gsum na gnas pa /
translated: whatever exists in the three worlds,

original: da ltar dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa thams cad de'i skad cig na ye shes kyis mngon du byed pa ni mthong ba ste shes bya'i don to //
analyzed: da ltar dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa thams cad de'i skad cig na ye shes kyis mngon du byed pa ni mthong ba ste shes bya'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the knowable object is that all of the past, present, and future are actualized by gnosis in that moment.

original: gang gis she na 'od gsal bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gis she na 'od gsal bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: By what? It is said to be by the clear light, and so on.

original: 'od gsal ba'i ye shes rnam par dag cing dri ma med pa de yis so //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i ye shes rnam par dag cing dri ma med pa de yis so //
translated: It is by that clear light gnosis, which is pure and stainless.

original: gang gi phyir 'od gsal ba'i ye shes la glo bur gyi dri ma'i sgrib pa dang bcas pa de bas na de rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'od gsal ba'i ye shes la glo bur gyi dri ma'i sgrib pa dang bcas pa de bas na de rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that clear light gnosis is associated with adventitious obscurations, it is for the sake of purifying that.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal sems 'di la //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal sems 'di la //
translated: This mind, which is clear light by nature,

original: glo bur pa yi dri ma ste //
analyzed: glo bur pa yi dri ma ste //
translated: Is obscured by adventitious stains.

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' ltar //üîΩdag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' ltar // dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
translated: Like the water element, gold, and space,

original: ces gsungs @147a * //
analyzed: ces gsungs @147a * //
translated: It is held to be pure by purification.

original: so ; / de nyid 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la gang gong du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: so ; / de nyid 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la gang gong du bstan pa ste /
translated: That very thing is these, and so on. What was taught above

original: de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: It is the intuition which has the characteristic of the non-erroneous realization of reality.

original: de dpal 'dus pa'i rgyud du rgyas btab pa ste /
analyzed: de dpal 'dus pa'i rgyud du rgyas btab pa ste /
translated: It is sealed in the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra,

original: shin tu gsang par gnas pas so //
analyzed: shin tu gsang par gnas pas so //
translated: because it is situated in the most secret.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo la bstan par bya ba ma yin pas rgyas btab pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo la bstan par bya ba ma yin pas rgyas btab pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a seal, because it is not to be shown to the naive, the ordinary person.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: Following the explanatory tantras,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: this is what is said.

original: dgongs pa lung bstan pa la sogs pas khong du chud par bya zhing shes par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgongs pa lung bstan pa la sogs pas khong du chud par bya zhing shes par bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it is to be understood and known by means of the Sandhivyakarana and so forth.

original: de yang rang nyid kyis ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rang nyid kyis ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not by oneself,

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: but how?

original: bla ma'i kha las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bla ma'i kha las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, from the guru's mouth,

original: slob dpon gyi man ngag brgyud pa las te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi man ngag brgyud pa las te /
translated: from the teacher's instructions in the lineage,

original: rang nyid 'ba' zhig gi dbang du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid 'ba' zhig gi dbang du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not for oneself alone.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji bzhin sgra yi don ni yongs su brtags gyur na //
analyzed: ji bzhin sgra yi don ni yongs su brtags gyur na //
translated: Having fully examined the meaning of the words as they are,

original: rang nyid yid ches nyams pa 'thob ces ston pas gsungs//
analyzed: rang nyid yid ches nyams pa 'thob ces ston pas gsungs//
translated: the teacher says that one will attain the loss of self-confidence.

original: zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: da ni rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi srog dang rtsol ba bsgom pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi srog dang rtsol ba bsgom pa ston te /
translated: Now, the cultivation of prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅma in the reality of wind is taught.

original: rlung rnam par rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rlung rnam par rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to conquer the winds and in order to stabilize the mind, the words beginning with ‚Äúthere‚Äù are as follows.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: There means to ascertain.

original: mdor bstan pa'i tshig des na mdor byas pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i tshig des na mdor byas pa yin pa'o //
translated: By those words of brief indication, it is summarized.

original: 'jug pa ni 'dir drangs nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'dir drangs nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: The introduction should be brought here and explained.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: sna'i rtse mor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sna'i rtse mor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: At the tip of the nose and so on.

original: rdo rje'i tshig 'dis so so'i skye bo'i sems can rnams skye ba dang brtags pa'i lha la dmigs pa rlung gi de kho na nyid dang / yongs su dag pa'i lha'i de kho na nyid kyang rgyas par bstan te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig 'dis so so'i skye bo'i sems can rnams skye ba dang brtags pa'i lha la dmigs pa rlung gi de kho na nyid dang / yongs su dag pa'i lha'i de kho na nyid kyang rgyas par bstan te /
translated: By these vajra statements, the reality of the wind and the reality of the completely pure deity are extensively taught for ordinary beings who focus on the deity generated and imagined.

original: thog ma sems can bskyed pa'i rgyu bstan par bya na /
analyzed: thog ma sems can bskyed pa'i rgyu bstan par bya na /
translated: If it is asked what is the cause of generating the sentient beings at the beginning,

original: steng na gnas pa'i srog dang rtsol ba dbang po gnyis mnyam par sbyor ba'i dga' bas bskyod nas yan lag thams cad du chags pa chen po'i mes zhu bar byas nas /üîΩbyang chub kyi sems thig le'i ngo bos padma'i ge sar du lhung ba ste 'di ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa rnams la /

translated: The bodhicitta element falls into the calyx of the lotus through the power of the great passion of the melting of the bodhicitta element by the fire of great passion, which is aroused by the union of the two organs of the life-force and exertion located above.üîΩThis is the definitive meaning of the statement by the TathƒÅgata in the Tantra of the Great River of the Inconceivable Secrets of Alikali that the bodhicitta element falls into the calyx of the lotus through the power of the great passion of the melting of the bodhicitta element by the fire of great passion, which is aroused by the union of the two organs of the life-force and exertion located above.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yungs kar gyi sgras brdar bstan te /üîΩyungs kar zhes bya ba ni de la /üîΩde la yungs kar ni byang chub sems kyi thig le ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yungs kar gyi sgras brdar bstan te / yungs kar zhes bya ba ni de la / de la yungs kar ni byang chub sems kyi thig le ste /
translated: This is the definitive meaning of the statement by the TathƒÅgata in the Tantra of the Great River of the Inconceivable Secrets of Alikali that the bodhicitta element falls into the calyx of the lotus through the power of the great passion of the melting of the bodhicitta element by the fire of great passion, which is aroused by the union of the two organs of the life-force and exertion located above.

analyzed: de'i nang @147b du ; 'jig rten thams cad skye bar 'gyur // zhes rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: This is the definitive meaning of the statement by the TathƒÅgata in the Tantra of the Great River of the Inconceivable Secrets of Alikali that the bodhicitta element falls into the calyx of the lotus through the power of the great passion of the melting of the bodhicitta element by the fire of great passion, which is aroused by the union of the two organs of the life-force and exertion located above.

analyzed: shu kra bdud rtsi zhes byar bshad // de las 'gro ba gsum po skye //
translated: This is the definitive meaning of the statement by the TathƒÅgata in the Tantra of the Great River of the Inconceivable Secrets of Alikali that the bodhicitta element falls into the calyx of the lotus through the power of the great passion of the melting of the bodhicitta element by the fire of great passion, which is aroused by the union of the two organs of the life-force and exertion located above.üîΩThis is the definitive meaning of the statement by the TathƒÅgata in the Tantra of the Great River of the Inconceivable Secrets of Alikali that the bodhicitta element falls into the calyx of the lotus through the power of the great passion of the melting of the bodhicitta element by the fire of great passion, which is aroused by the union of the two organs of the life-force and exertion located above.

original: zhes 'byung ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: This is the definitive meaning of the statement by the T

original: yungs kar zhes bya ba ni yungs kar gyi 'bru tshod tsam ste /
analyzed: yungs kar zhes bya ba ni yungs kar gyi 'bru tshod tsam ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMustard seed‚Äù means the size of a mustard seed.

original: de la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in that.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: snying gar de ltar bsgom par bya //
analyzed: snying gar de ltar bsgom par bya //
translated: one should meditate on it at the heart.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: ‚ÄúWith effort‚Äù means with complete abandonment of distraction.

translated: ‚ÄúAs long as‚Äù means as long as the mind is in equipoise.

original: bsgoms zhes bya ba ni goms par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgoms zhes bya ba ni goms par bya'o //

original: rnal 'byor rig pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa shes pas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa shes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe yogi who knows reality‚Äù means the one who knows the ultimate.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni zo chun brgyud pa ltar rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni zo chun brgyud pa ltar rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù means without interruption, like the flow of a river.

original: de dag ni dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: These are the intentional explanations.

original: de nyid rdo rje'i tshig gis slar bshad pa lha mo bzhis zhus pa zhes bya ba bshad pa'i rgyud las /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje'i tshig gis slar bshad pa lha mo bzhis zhus pa zhes bya ba bshad pa'i rgyud las /
translated: That is explained again with vajra words in the Tantra of the Questions of the Four Goddesses.

original: rdo rje 'chad zhes  bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chad zhes  bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase Vajra Speech is a remainder of the words.

original: de 'dir drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de 'dir drang bar bya ste /
translated: That is to be interpreted here.

original: de ni lha mo bshad par bya //
analyzed: de ni lha mo bshad par bya //
translated: That is to be explained by the goddesses.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis ni go sla'o //
translated: The two verses beginning with these words are easy to understand.

original: 'on kyang de kho na nyid ni thig le'i ngo bo ste /üîΩde'i dbus na gnas pa'i lha ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i ngo bo bde ba @148a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang de kho na nyid ni thig le'i ngo bo ste / de'i dbus na gnas pa'i lha ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i ngo bo bde ba @148a * //
translated: However, reality is the essence of the drop.

original: chen po'i dang ste /
analyzed: chen po'i dang ste /
translated: The god who abides in its center is the nature of reflexive awareness, the essence of the four great elements, the nature of great bliss.

original: de yang mi gsal ba ni rtog pa'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de yang mi gsal ba ni rtog pa'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas skabs so //
translated: Moreover, the unclear one is the stage of the yoga of imagination.

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid ni rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid ni rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The clear one is the stage of completion.

original: don de nyid 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma'i le'u bco brgyad par yan lag drug bsgom pa'i gnas skabs su srog dang / rtsol ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi yan lag gnyis tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: don de nyid 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma'i le'u bco brgyad par yan lag drug bsgom pa'i gnas skabs su srog dang / rtsol ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi yan lag gnyis tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: That very meaning is taught by two verses in the eighteenth chapter of the Later Tantra, in the context of the cultivation of the six-branched yoga, with the two branches of vitality and exertion and retention.

original: ye shes lnga zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes lnga zhes bya ba la /
translated: The nature of the five intuitionsüîΩis the fivefold life-breath.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid pas na ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid pas na ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the five intuitions is the nature of the five intuitions, such as the mirror-intuition, etc.

original: dbugs zhes bya ba ni gyen du rgyu ba'i rlung gi rnam pa'i sems te /
analyzed: dbugs zhes bya ba ni gyen du rgyu ba'i rlung gi rnam pa'i sems te /
translated: The life-breath is the mind in the aspect of the upward-moving wind,

original: mgrin pa dang / rkan dang / mchu gnyis kyi bar du khyab pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa dang / rkan dang / mchu gnyis kyi bar du khyab pa'o //
translated: which pervades the throat, palate, and the space between the two lips.

original: lnga zhes bya ba ni spyan la sogs pa lha mo'i rang bzhin nyid pas na 'byung ba bzhi'i ngo bos te nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba ni spyan la sogs pa lha mo'i rang bzhin nyid pas na 'byung ba bzhi'i ngo bos te nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The five are the five elements, earth, etc., and the fifth is space.

original: byung nas ni zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i lam nas so sor snang zhing dmigs par byas pa'o ;
analyzed: byung nas ni zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i lam nas so sor snang zhing dmigs par byas pa'o ;
translated: Having arisen from the vajra path, it appears individually and is visualized.

original: / padma zhes bya ba ni lha mo'i padma'i ze'u 'brur bsgom par bya ba ste /üîΩphra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom ba na //
analyzed: / padma zhes bya ba ni lha mo'i padma'i ze'u 'brur bsgom par bya ba ste / phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom ba na //
translated: The lotus is the lotus of the goddess, on the pistil-receptacle, where one should meditate.

original: skyo'am 'jug pa'i don du bsgom par zhes kha cig  'chad do //
analyzed: skyo'am 'jug pa'i don du bsgom par zhes kha cig  'chad do //
translated: Some explain that the meditation on the subtle yoga is for the purpose of entering or penetrating.

original: gzhan dag ni phra mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzhi nyid bas na /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni phra mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzhi nyid bas na /
translated: Others say that because it is the basis of the subtle ma·πá·∏çala,

original: mtshan ma'i dbus na gnas par byas nas de bsgom par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i dbus na gnas par byas nas de bsgom par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: in the middle of the sign means that one should meditate on it after having placed it there.

original: kha dog sna lnga ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig gi mjug bsdu ba ste go sla'o //
analyzed: kha dog sna lnga ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig gi mjug bsdu ba ste go sla'o //
translated: The phrase of five colors and so forth is a summary of the words, and is easy to understand.

original: thig le'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang du byas nas ni sreg dang rtsol ba bsgom pa ston to //
analyzed: thig le'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang du byas nas ni sreg dang rtsol ba bsgom pa ston to //
translated: With regard to the yoga of the drop, it teaches the meditation on the fire and the exertion.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang du byas nas ni 'dzin pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang du byas nas ni 'dzin pa'i don ston te /
translated: With regard to the subtle yoga, it teaches the meaning of retention.

original: rang sngags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang sngags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the phrase one's own mantra and so forth,

original: snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i snying ga'i zla ba la rang gi lha'i sa bon gyi yi ge ji lta ba bzhin thig le'i gzugs su byas shing srog gi rlung dang kun du ldan par bsgom pa ste sems kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i snying ga'i zla ba la rang gi lha'i sa bon gyi yi ge ji lta ba bzhin thig le'i gzugs su byas shing srog gi rlung dang kun du ldan par bsgom pa ste sems kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The mental object is the meditation on the seed syllable of one's deity in the form of a drop in the moon at the heart of the gnosis being at the heart, endowed with the life-force wind.

original: sems ni yid de thig ler gyur pa'i thig le la bsgom zhing bkod nas de nyid yang  dang yang du 'dris par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems ni yid de thig ler gyur pa'i thig le la bsgom zhing bkod nas de nyid yang  dang yang du 'dris par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mind is the mental faculty, and the drop is the drop that has become the object of meditation. Having placed the mind there, one should familiarize oneself with that again and again.

original: gzhan dag ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i mchan ma'i dbus su sa bon dmigs nas yid kyis 'byin dur gyur par bya zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor rang gi ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i mchan ma'i dbus su sa bon dmigs nas yid kyis 'byin dur gyur par bya zhes 'chad do //
translated: Others explain that subtle yoga is visualizing the seed in the center of the sign at the heart of one's gnosis being and mentally emanating and withdrawing it.

original: 'dzin pa ston @148b te 'di yang rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya ba'i rgyud las slar bshad pa zhes bya ba 'di yang /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ston @148b te 'di yang rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya ba'i rgyud las slar bshad pa zhes bya ba 'di yang /
translated: The explanation of retention is also explained in the Vajra Garland Tantra.

original: slar bshad pa ni rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: slar bshad pa ni rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the commentary.

original: sna'i rtse mor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sna'i rtse mor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Regarding at the tip of the nose, and so on,

original: yungs kar zhes bya ba ni thig le'i ming du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yungs kar zhes bya ba ni thig le'i ming du gyur pa'o //
translated: The term sesame is a name for the bindu.

original: de la yang srog dang rtsol ba dang rlung gi de kho na nyid rtag cing bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la yang srog dang rtsol ba dang rlung gi de kho na nyid rtag cing bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There, one should always meditate on the reality of prƒÅ·πáa, ƒÅyƒÅma, and vƒÅyu.

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: There, too, it is said:

original: 'od lnga sangs rgyas rnams su bsgom //
analyzed: 'od lnga sangs rgyas rnams su bsgom //
translated: Meditate on the five lights as the buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ye shes lnga rnam par dag pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ye shes lnga rnam par dag pas /
translated: Since the five pristine consciousnesses are pure,

original: mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / lte ba dang / gsang ba dang / lus thams cad du khyab par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / lte ba dang / gsang ba dang / lus thams cad du khyab par gnas pa'o //
translated: they exist pervading the throat, heart, navel, secret [place], and the whole body.

original: 'dir 'di skad gsungs te /üîΩme long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga'i rang bzhin srog dang rtsol bar gyur nas /
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad gsungs te / me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga'i rang bzhin srog dang rtsol bar gyur nas /
translated: Here, this is what is said:

original: sna'i rtse mo'i ba spu'i bu ga nas /
analyzed: sna'i rtse mo'i ba spu'i bu ga nas /
translated: Having become prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅma, the nature of the five [pristine consciousnesses] such as the mirror-like pristine consciousness,üîΩthey definitely emerge from the pores of the tip of the nose

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhis bskor zhing rim par sbyar te nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhis bskor zhing rim par sbyar te nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: surrounded by the four great elements.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i ri bo des ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rdub  pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su dran nas de yang rnal 'byor pas gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin bsam par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i ri bo des ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rdub  pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su dran nas de yang rnal 'byor pas gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin bsam par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The mountain of coming and going is the mindfulness of the characteristics of inhalation and exhalation. The meaning is that the yogi should contemplate them as they are in the present moment.

original: rlung bsgom pa de yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rlung bsgom pa de yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The cultivation of the wind has six aspects.

original: chos mngon pa'i mdzod las 'di skad du /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mdzod las 'di skad du /
translated: The Abhidharma-ko≈õa states:üîΩCounting, following, fixing,üîΩcharacteristics, transformation,

original: grangs dang rjes 'gro 'jog pa dang // mtshan nyid dang ni rnam 'gyur dang // yongs su dag dang drug po 'di //üîΩdbugs rdub  dbugs dbyung dran par 'dod //
analyzed: grangs dang rjes 'gro 'jog pa dang // mtshan nyid dang ni rnam 'gyur dang // yongs su dag dang drug po 'di // dbugs rdub  dbugs dbyung dran par 'dod //
translated: and purification are the six.

original: ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are considered mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: dbugs rdub  pa ni nang du 'jug pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: dbugs rdub  pa ni nang du 'jug pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: Inhalation is the wind that enters inside.

original: dbugs dbyung ba ni phyir rgyu ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung ba ni phyir rgyu ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: Exhalation is the wind that moves outside.

original: de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rdub  pa dran pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rdub  pa dran pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that observes that is mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: dran pa'i rgyu nyid pas na dran pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dran pa'i rgyu nyid pas na dran pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Because it is the cause of mindfulness, it is explained as mindfulness.

original: de la grangs zhes bya ba ni lus sems ngag goms pa blan te /
analyzed: de la grangs zhes bya ba ni lus sems ngag goms pa blan te /
translated: The so-called number is the body, mind, and speech.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rdub  pa tsam la gtad nas grangs gcig dang gnyis nas bcu'i bar du de ltar yang dang yang du bya'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rdub  pa tsam la gtad nas grangs gcig dang gnyis nas bcu'i bar du de ltar yang dang yang du bya'o //
translated: Having restrained them, one should focus on the mere exhalation and inhalation of breath, and count from one to ten, doing it again and again.

original: 'di'i skyon ni rnam pa gsum ste ma tshang ba'i grangs zhes bya ba gal te gnyis la gcig tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skyon ni rnam pa gsum ste ma tshang ba'i grangs zhes bya ba gal te gnyis la gcig tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The faults of this are threefold: the so-called incomplete number is if one takes two as one;

original: lhag pa'i grangs zhes bya ba gcig la gnyis su sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i grangs zhes bya ba gcig la gnyis su sbyor ba'o //
translated: the so-called excessive number is if one takes one as two;üîΩand the so-called mistaken number is if one takes exhalation as inhalation,

original: log pa'i grangs ni gang dbugs rdub  pa la dbugs 'byung bar 'dod pa'am /üîΩdbugs @149a * //
analyzed: log pa'i grangs ni gang dbugs rdub  pa la dbugs 'byung bar 'dod pa'am / dbugs @149a * //
translated: The wrong count is when one thinks that the exhalation is the inhalation,üîΩor vice versa.üîΩ

original: 'byung ba la rdub  par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba la rdub  par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: takes inhalation as exhalation.

original: de las gzhan pa ni yang dag pa'i grangs so //üîΩbar du g-yeng ba na slar yang dang po'i grangs nas brtsams nas bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni yang dag pa'i grangs so // bar du g-yeng ba na slar yang dang po'i grangs nas brtsams nas bya ba ste /
translated: Other than that is the correct number.

original: ji srid ting nge 'dzin thob pa de srid du'o //
analyzed: ji srid ting nge 'dzin thob pa de srid du'o //
translated: If distracted in the middle, one should start again from the beginning and do it until samƒÅdhi is attained.

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub pa 'jug pa'i rlung ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub pa 'jug pa'i rlung ste /
translated: The so-called following is the effortless engaged breath.

original: mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / lte ba dang / rked pa dang / brla dang / rje ngar dang / rkang pa'i bar du rim gyis 'jug cing 'gro ba'o //üîΩ'byung ba ni mtho gang ngam do'am /
analyzed: mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / lte ba dang / rked pa dang / brla dang / rje ngar dang / rkang pa'i bar du rim gyis 'jug cing 'gro ba'o // 'byung ba ni mtho gang ngam do'am /
translated: It moves and goes gradually from the crown of the head, the throat, the heart, the navel, the hips, the thighs, the calves, and the feet.

original: 'dom gang gi bar du'o //
analyzed: 'dom gang gi bar du'o //
translated: The arising is from one finger width, one cubit,

original: 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or one fathom.üîΩThe placement is from the tip of the nose to the toes,

original: sna'i rtse mo nas rkang pa'i mthe bo'i bar du rin po che'i phreng ba ltar gnas par blta ste /üîΩ'di rjes su 'dzin par byed pa zhig gam /
analyzed: sna'i rtse mo nas rkang pa'i mthe bo'i bar du rin po che'i phreng ba ltar gnas par blta ste / 'di rjes su 'dzin par byed pa zhig gam /
translated: viewing it as a jeweled necklace.üîΩIs it a protector?

original: gnod par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'am /
translated: Is it a harm-doer?

original: grang ba'am dro ba gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: grang ba'am dro ba gcig ces bya'o //
translated: Is it cold or hot?

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'di ni rlung 'ba' zhig kho na yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'di ni rlung 'ba' zhig kho na yin te /
translated: The characteristic is the mere wind,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams dang / de la brten pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba phung po lnga nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams dang / de la brten pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams dang / sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba phung po lnga nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: indicating the five aggregates: the four great elements and the mind and mental factors that are based on them.

original: rnam par bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The transformation is

original: rlung gi rnam pa blos bsgyur nas gong nas gong du dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du skyed pa ste /
analyzed: rlung gi rnam pa blos bsgyur nas gong nas gong du dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du skyed pa ste /
translated: The wind-energies are transformed by the mind, and the roots of virtue are increasingly generated.

original: ji srid chos kyi mchog dang po'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid chos kyi mchog dang po'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is as long as the first yoga of the supreme mundane level, and so on.

original: yongs su dag pa ni gang mthong ba'i lam la sogs par dkyil 'khor gyi mchog gi ting nge 'dzin kun du sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni gang mthong ba'i lam la sogs par dkyil 'khor gyi mchog gi ting nge 'dzin kun du sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: The completely purified is that which connects the samƒÅdhi of the supreme ma·πá·∏çala on the path of seeing, and so on.

original: de gang gi tshe sna'i rtse mo nas nges par 'byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe sna'i rtse mo nas nges par 'byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: When it definitely emerges from the tip of the nose, then

original: g-yon nas g-yas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩkha cig  tu g-yon pa'i sna'i rtse mo las /
analyzed: g-yon nas g-yas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / kha cig  tu g-yon pa'i sna'i rtse mo las /
translated: ‚Äúfrom the left to the right,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIn some cases, it is from the left nostril.

original: kha cig  tu g-yas pa'i sna'i rtse mo las /
analyzed: kha cig  tu g-yas pa'i sna'i rtse mo las /
translated: In some cases, it is from the right nostril.

original: kha cig  tu gnyis ka las /
analyzed: kha cig  tu gnyis ka las /
translated: In some cases, it is from both.

original: dal bar rgyu ba ni gnyi ga kho na ste /
analyzed: dal bar rgyu ba ni gnyi ga kho na ste /
translated: The slow movement is from both.

original: rim gyis rim gyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rim gyis rim gyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is entering gradually, gradually.

original: yang na ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ma yin pa'o //
translated: Or it is not.

original: rnam bzhir 'gyur zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: rnam bzhir 'gyur zhes bya ba la //
translated: ‚ÄúIt becomes fourfold.‚Äù

original: rim pa 'dis dus rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis dus rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: By this process, there are four times.

original: de sa ni rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de sa ni rgyu ba'o //
translated: That is the movement.

original: de yang nang gir bshad do //
analyzed: de yang nang gir bshad do //
translated: This is the inner.

original: rlung de kho na nyid 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i dkyil 'khor la khyab pas na gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rlung de kho na nyid 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i dkyil 'khor la khyab pas na gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that wind pervades the ma·πá·∏çala of the four great elements, it is called ‚Äúabiding.‚Äù

original: de ni dus te rgyu ba ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: de ni dus te rgyu ba ni rlung ngo //
translated: That is time, and movement is wind.

original: thun phyed phyed rlung kun du rgyu @149b zhing gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thun phyed phyed rlung kun du rgyu @149b zhing gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of ‚Äúhalf-periods, winds move and abide.‚Äù

original: go rims ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni de dkyil 'khor so so'i lha gnas pa las ma 'das pa ste /
analyzed: go rims ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni de dkyil 'khor so so'i lha gnas pa las ma 'das pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the order‚Äù means that the deities of each ma·πá·∏çala do not go beyond abiding.

original: 'dir don mdor bstan pa la ni 'di'o //
analyzed: 'dir don mdor bstan pa la ni 'di'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of the brief explanation is this.

analyzed: da ni lus gdung ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas sngags mi 'grub par bshad pa ston te /

original: slong mo za zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: slong mo za zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: slong ba'i tshogs ni slong ba pa ste /
analyzed: slong ba'i tshogs ni slong ba pa ste /

analyzed: slong mo'i ngang tshul gyis zas bza' zhing bzla bar mi bya ba ste /

analyzed: bzlas brjod gdon par mi bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúOne should not recite the mantra.‚Äù

original: slong mo'i zas zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don to /üîΩdes na yongs su tshol ba la sogs pa gzhan rnams dang ldan pas bza' bar mi bya zhes bya bar dgongs so //

translated: The phrase ‚Äúfood of alms‚Äù is a synecdoche.üîΩTherefore, it is intended that one should not eat while possessing other things such as searching.

original: ma bslangs pa'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ma bslangs pa'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúOne should not eat without begging and so on.‚Äù

analyzed: gang bslangs pa las gzhan 'bad pa med par rnyed pa'i bza' ba ni ma bslangs pa'o //

original: de la yang chags shing zhen par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la yang chags shing zhen par mi bya ba ste /

analyzed: ji srid du lus gnas par 'gyur ba de tsam gyis chog shes shing /

analyzed: mchog tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice the supreme unelaborated conduct.

original: ji ltar bzla bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bzla bar bya zhe na /

analyzed: ma nyams bzlas zhes pa ste /

original: sngags ni yi ge gsum mam gzhan pa ste /

original: ma nyams zhes bya ba lha nyid dang dbyer med pa'am /

translated: ‚Äú Without decline‚Äù means not separate from the deity or

analyzed: gang gi bzla zhe na / 'dod kun la longs spyod byed cing //

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúOne who enjoys all desires.‚Äù

analyzed: sems bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par gyur nas /
translated: Having attained the state of concentration with a blissful mind,

analyzed: 'di rnams la longs spyod ces bya ba ni /
translated: Here, enjoyment means

original: da ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid 'di kho na mdor bstan pa bshad pa'i rgyud dgongs pa lung bstan pa las rgyas par gsungs pas de la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid 'di kho na mdor bstan pa bshad pa'i rgyud dgongs pa lung bstan pa las rgyas par gsungs pas de la 'jug par bya ste /

original: slar gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: slar gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: gang la gsol zhe na /

analyzed: gsol zhes bya ba ni las gnyis pa ste /

analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa bzhis gsol ba gdab pa'o //

analyzed: brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /

analyzed: sems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: sems can thams cad skyed pa de bas na /

analyzed: de ni rgyu'i lnga pa'o //

analyzed: de bas dngos po med gyur kyang //

analyzed: de las skyes shing byung bar gyur //

original: ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes /

analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: lan mang du bkag pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rang rig pa'i shes pas nyams su myong ba ste nyams su myong ba dang bcas pa'i shes pas mnyam par gzhag nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: bdag po zhes bya'o //

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyang yin pas na rnam par snang mdzad chen po ste khyad par ni bsdu ba'o //

analyzed: ci zhig mdzad nas she na /

analyzed: gsungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said means it is spoken.

original: bshad par bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bshad par bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is explained means it is taught.

original: tshigs su bcad pa byed dang gnyis kyis sngags kyis bye brag rnam pa bzhi ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa byed dang gnyis kyis sngags kyis bye brag rnam pa bzhi ston te /
translated: The two verses beginning with made show the four kinds of distinctions in mantra.

original: rab tu phye ba nas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi gsal bar phye nas zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩnyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i don gang yin pa de ni rnam par mi @153a * //
analyzed: rab tu phye ba nas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi gsal bar phye nas zhes bya ba'i don to // nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i don gang yin pa de ni rnam par mi @153a * //
translated: Distinction means the four kinds are clearly distinguished.

original: rtog pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtog pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of non-conceptuality is the meaning of abandoning the conceptual thoughts of afflictions.üîΩNon-conceptuality means not conceptualizing.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni ji lta ba bzhin khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni ji lta ba bzhin khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Its reality is the thorough understanding of things as they are.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar sngags kyi don yi ge bsgrub pa'i bdag nyid can thog ma gsung pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar sngags kyi don yi ge bsgrub pa'i bdag nyid can thog ma gsung pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the mantra is the accomplishment of the syllables, which is taught first.

original: brjod pa ni ston pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ni ston pa ste /
translated: The expression is the teaching.

original: de yang yi ge re re la brten nas btu ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang yi ge re re la brten nas btu ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And that is called the extraction based on each syllable.

original: sbyor ba 'di dang ldan pas dmigs pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa zhes bya'o //üîΩbrjod pa yang yin la /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di dang ldan pas dmigs pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa zhes bya'o // brjod pa yang yin la /
translated: The objective support is that which is attained by means of the application endowed with this.

original: dmigs pa yang yin pas na brjod pa dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang yin pas na brjod pa dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is both an expression and an objective support, so it is an expressed objective support.

original: khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the special inclusion.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: As for buddhahood,

original: de yang sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'o //
translated: buddhahood is the attainment of the state of Vajradhara.

original: nye bar dmigs pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the cause for attaining the objective support.

original: 'dis sngags btu ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis sngags btu ba ste /
translated: This is the extraction of the mantra,

original: gnyis pa ston to //üîΩbrda zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ston to // brda zhes bya ba la /
translated: which is taught second.üîΩAs for sign,

original: sbrul la sogs pa'i ming dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa'i ming dang ldan pa ste /
translated: it is endowed with the names of the snake and so forth.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras thog mtha' med pa'i sngags dang / btu ba'i sngags dang / mtha' med kyi sngags rnams shes par bya'o /
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras thog mtha' med pa'i sngags dang / btu ba'i sngags dang / mtha' med kyi sngags rnams shes par bya'o /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù should be understood to include mantras without a beginning or end, mantras to be recited, and mantras without an end.

original: de la aom zhes bya ba dang po dang / sv'a h'a mthar gnas pa'i sprul lta bu'i sngags te thog mtha' gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la aom zhes bya ba dang po dang / sv'a h'a mthar gnas pa'i sprul lta bu'i sngags te thog mtha' gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A mantra with a head and a tail is like a snake, with the syllable O·πÉ at the beginning and SVƒÄHƒÄ at the end, because it has both a beginning and an end.

original: aom dang sv'a h'a med pa'i sngags badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mgo med kyi sngags te /
analyzed: aom dang sv'a h'a med pa'i sngags badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mgo med kyi sngags te /
translated: A mantra without a head is one that does not have O·πÉ at the beginning and SVƒÄHƒÄ at the end, such as the mantra VAJRADH·πöK.

original: thog mtha' gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbtu ba'i sngags ni dbyangs dang gsal byed thod lo kor gyis rnam par phye bas te /
analyzed: thog mtha' gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro // btu ba'i sngags ni dbyangs dang gsal byed thod lo kor gyis rnam par phye bas te /
translated: It is called a mantra without a head because it does not have both a beginning and an end.

original: phreng ba lta bu'i sngags la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: phreng ba lta bu'i sngags la sogs pa'am /
translated: A mantra to be recited is one that is divided into sections by the vowels and consonants, like a garland of flowers.

original: gzhan yang btus nas rnam par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang btus nas rnam par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also called a mantra to be recited because it is recited and then put together again.

original: mtha' med kyi sngags ni aom dang ldan la sv'a h'a ni med pa ste mtha' dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' med kyi sngags ni aom dang ldan la sv'a h'a ni med pa ste mtha' dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A mantra without an end is one that has O·πÉ at the beginning but does not have SVƒÄHƒÄ at the end, because it does not have an end.

original: 'di dag ni sngags kyi brda brjod pa ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sngags kyi brda brjod pa ste gsum pa'o //
translated: These are the three mantra expressions.

original: sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni ma nyams pa las byung bas na sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni ma nyams pa las byung bas na sngags kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: The so-called mantra reality is called the mantra reality because it arises from the undamaged, the fourth.

original: de ni don dam pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni don dam pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is the ultimate itself.

original: de zhes bya ba la bshad ma thag pa rnam pa bzhi yang don dam pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba la bshad ma thag pa rnam pa bzhi yang don dam pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The so-called is the just explained four aspects, which are called the ultimate itself.

original: don dam pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is the ultimate cause, that is the meaning.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result is imputed to the cause.

original: sngags kyi dbye ba rnam pa bzhi yang bstan to //
analyzed: sngags kyi dbye ba rnam pa bzhi yang bstan to //
translated: The four divisions of mantra are also taught.

original: da ni yi ge'i don gyi rnam pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni yi ge'i don gyi rnam pa ston te /
translated: Now the form of the meaning of the syllables is taught.

original: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: One and so on.

original: gcig ni mi 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo dang po'i yi ge aa ste don dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig ni mi 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo dang po'i yi ge aa ste don dam pa nyid do //
translated: One is the unchanging intrinsic nature, the first syllable a, the ultimate itself.

original: @153b dgu dbus zhes bya ba yi ge sde tshan dgu'i grangs nges par bcad pa gang yin pa de'i dbus na ste gang gi phyir 'dir brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: @153b dgu dbus zhes bya ba yi ge sde tshan dgu'i grangs nges par bcad pa gang yin pa de'i dbus na ste gang gi phyir 'dir brjod pa'i don to //
translated: The middle of the nine groups is the middle of the groups of nine letters.

original: de bas na de med na ka dang ha'i bar du yi ge rnams brjod par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na de med na ka dang ha'i bar du yi ge rnams brjod par mi nus pa ste /
translated: Therefore, without it, the letters cannot be pronounced between ka and ha,

original: dbyangs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyangs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no vowel.

original: na'i sgra ni thams cad du yang gi don to //
analyzed: na'i sgra ni thams cad du yang gi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: gang zhig bcu yis ma bcings pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig bcu yis ma bcings pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which is not bound by the ten

original: dbyangs yi ge bcu drug gi nang nas snga ma'i yi ge brgyad ni thung du'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: dbyangs yi ge bcu drug gi nang nas snga ma'i yi ge brgyad ni thung du'i sde tshan no //
translated: The first eight letters of the sixteen vowels are the group of short vowels.

original: phyi ma brgyad ni ring bo'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: phyi ma brgyad ni ring bo'i sde tshan no //
translated: The last eight are the group of long vowels.

original: ka la sogs pa lnga'i sde tshan lnga dang / ya la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhi'i sde tshan dang / gzhan yang sha la sogs pa sde tshan brgyad pa'i tha ma dang / bcu pa mi 'gyur pa'i yi ge aa'o //
analyzed: ka la sogs pa lnga'i sde tshan lnga dang / ya la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhi'i sde tshan dang / gzhan yang sha la sogs pa sde tshan brgyad pa'i tha ma dang / bcu pa mi 'gyur pa'i yi ge aa'o //
translated: The five groups beginning with ka, the group of the four elements beginning with ya, the last of the eight groups beginning with ≈õa, and the tenth letter a of the unchanging.

original: de yang kha cig  ni aa dang gzhan tha dad pa'i sde tshan kho nar 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang kha cig  ni aa dang gzhan tha dad pa'i sde tshan kho nar 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that it is a class that is different from a.

original: gang dag gi rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo bcu po 'di rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa'i ngag ma bcings pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo bcu po 'di rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa'i ngag ma bcings pa'o //
translated: Those whose speech is not bound by these ten conceptual natures are yogins.

original: de ni bcings med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni bcings med ces bya ba la /
translated: That is called ‚Äúunbound.‚Äù

original: ma bcings pa ni 'khor ba'i brtson ra las thar pa'o //
analyzed: ma bcings pa ni 'khor ba'i brtson ra las thar pa'o //
translated: Unbound means liberated from the prison of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: shes par bya zhes bya ba ni khong du chung par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes par bya zhes bya ba ni khong du chung par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú To be known‚Äù means to be understood.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the yogin.

original: shes pa mchog gi gnas zhes bya ba ni ngag gi rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i ngo bo mi 'gyur ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ste yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa mchog gi gnas zhes bya ba ni ngag gi rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i ngo bo mi 'gyur ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ste yi ge'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú The abode of supreme consciousness‚Äù means the abode of the unchanging nature that abandons the conceptualization of speech. This is the word-meaning.

original: bsdus pa'i spyi'i don ston te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i spyi'i don ston te /
translated: The general meaning of the summary is taught:

original: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩgcig nyid ni chos kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid kyi yi ge ste /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la / gcig nyid ni chos kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid kyi yi ge ste /
translated: ‚Äú One‚Äù and so on.

original: shes rab kyi rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚Äú One‚Äù is the characteristic of the dharma-mudra syllable, which is the nature of wisdom.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad skye ba'i 'byung gnas so ;
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad skye ba'i 'byung gnas so ;
translated: The first is the source of the birth of all sentient beings.

original: / dgu dbus na zhes bya ba ni yi ge de nyid phung po lnga dang / 'byung ba bzhi zhes bya ba'i dgu'i dbus na rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid gnas pa'o //
analyzed: / dgu dbus na zhes bya ba ni yi ge de nyid phung po lnga dang / 'byung ba bzhi zhes bya ba'i dgu'i dbus na rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid gnas pa'o //
translated: In the middle of the nine is the reality of self-awareness abiding in the middle of the nine, namely, the five aggregates and the four elements.

original: phung po dang 'byung ba dgu po rang bzhin 'di rnams dang bcas pas /üîΩaes kyang gang zhig bcings med pa //
analyzed: phung po dang 'byung ba dgu po rang bzhin 'di rnams dang bcas pas / aes kyang gang zhig bcings med pa //
translated: The nine aggregates and elements are bound by this nature.

original: zhes bya ste ;üîΩ'khor ba'i zhags pas ma bcings pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ste ; 'khor ba'i zhags pas ma bcings pa //
translated: The e also means not bound.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It means not bound by the noose of cyclic existence.

original: yi ge gsum gyi ngo bo nyid pas na /
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyi ngo bo nyid pas na /
translated: Since it is the nature of the three syllables,

original: lus ngag yid gsum mo //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum mo //
translated: it is body, speech, and mind.

original: de ni bcings med ces bya ba 'khor ba'i zhags pa las grol zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni bcings med ces bya ba 'khor ba'i zhags pa las grol zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is not bound, which means freed from the noose of cyclic existence.

original: shes par bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //üîΩde zhes bya ba ni rnal @154a * //
analyzed: shes par bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no // de zhes bya ba ni rnal @154a * //
translated: The knowable is as before.

original: 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: 'byor pa ste /
translated: The that is the yogi.

original: rig na zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i don to //
analyzed: rig na zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i don to //
translated: The if means the experience.

original: mchog gi gnas zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i rang gi ngo bo yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: mchog gi gnas zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i rang gi ngo bo yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúsupreme place‚Äù is the nature of great bliss, which is the identity of the three syllables.

original: spyi'i don de 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i don de 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The general meaning is because there is no regret.

original: slar yang spyi'i don ston to //
analyzed: slar yang spyi'i don ston to //
translated: Again, the general meaning is taught.

original: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: The first one, etc.

original: / gcig dang po gang yin pa de ni gcig dang po ste /
analyzed: / gcig dang po gang yin pa de ni gcig dang po ste /
translated: The first one is the first one.

original: a'a li'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: a'a li'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the order of the vowels.

original: gzhan yang gcig dang po gang yin pa de ni gcig dang po ste k'a li'o //üîΩdgu zhes bya ba ni sde tshan dgu'i mtshan nyid de gcig dang po yang yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gcig dang po gang yin pa de ni gcig dang po ste k'a li'o // dgu zhes bya ba ni sde tshan dgu'i mtshan nyid de gcig dang po yang yin la /
translated: Moreover, the first one is the first one.

original: sde tshan dgur bcas yang yin pas na /
analyzed: sde tshan dgur bcas yang yin pas na /
translated: Nine is the characteristic of the nine classes. Since it is the first one and it is endowed with the nine classes,

original: sde tshan dgu'i dang po ste /
analyzed: sde tshan dgu'i dang po ste /
translated: it is the first of the nine classes.

original: khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the special collection.

original: dbus zhes bya ba ni lus kyi lte ba ste /
analyzed: dbus zhes bya ba ni lus kyi lte ba ste /
translated: The center is the navel of the body.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The place is the remainder of the words.

original: bcu yi zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i phyi mo sde tshan dgu dang / dang po'i yi ge 'di rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bcu yi zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i phyi mo sde tshan dgu dang / dang po'i yi ge 'di rnams kyis so //
translated: The tenth is the first letter of the nine classes and the first letter of this.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni bsgom pa goms pa dang ldan pa'o//
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni bsgom pa goms pa dang ldan pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúWhoever‚Äù refers to one who is endowed with the practice of meditation.

original: ma bcings pa zhes bya ba ni ma bsdams pa ste /
analyzed: ma bcings pa zhes bya ba ni ma bsdams pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúUnbound‚Äù means unfettered.

original: sde tshan de rnams sgyu ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: sde tshan de rnams sgyu ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Those groups have the nature of illusion,

original: brjod ma thag tu 'jig pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: brjod ma thag tu 'jig pas kyang ngo //
translated: because they are destroyed immediately upon being expressed.

original: de ni bcing med ces bya ba ni ngag gi rang bzhin yi ge rnams la ma zhen zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni bcing med ces bya ba ni ngag gi rang bzhin yi ge rnams la ma zhen zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not bound‚Äù means that one should not be attached to the syllables that are the nature of speech.

original: gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i phyi mo bsgom pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i phyi mo bsgom pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to one who is endowed with the meditation on the syllables.

original: rig ces bya ba ni shes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rig ces bya ba ni shes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge‚Äù means the object of knowledge.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i yi ge phyi mo brjod pa'i gnas kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i yi ge phyi mo brjod pa'i gnas kyi khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSupreme‚Äù is the special place of expression of the illusory syllables.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la sogs pa goms pa spyi'i don bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la sogs pa goms pa spyi'i don bshad pa ston to //
translated: This teaches the general meaning of the practice of the creation stage, and so on.

original: da ni sbas pa'i bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni sbas pa'i bshad pa ston te /
translated: Now, the hidden explanation is taught.

original: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la kha cig  ni srog gi ngo bo rlung byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la kha cig  ni srog gi ngo bo rlung byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: In the statement one, etc., some say that the life-force is the nature of wind, which is the nature of bodhicitta.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni mchog go //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni mchog go //

original: dgu dbus na zhes bya ba ni rlung dgu po rnams kyi dbus te /
analyzed: dgu dbus na zhes bya ba ni rlung dgu po rnams kyi dbus te /
translated: In the middle of the nine, the middle of the nine winds,

original: snying po zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: snying po zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to essence.

original: rlung dgu po rnams ni sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rlung dgu po rnams ni sngar bshad pa'o //

original: bcu yis zhes bya ba ni rlung dgu dang / dang po'i rlung srog gi ngo bo dang bcus so //
analyzed: bcu yis zhes bya ba ni rlung dgu dang / dang po'i rlung srog gi ngo bo dang bcus so //
